column4: hi buddy i need ur help about my wireless card. every time i start my laptop, to enable my wireless card i need to pass a command in terminal i.e. sudo modprob b43. can you please let me know how to avoid this
add the word 'b43' to the /etc/modules file, it will then be loaded at boot
i have added the b43 module in the modules file, i am going to reboot now to check, thanks to you in advance.
i have rebooted and it works gr8
there was another entry in modules files i.e. ls
there was another entry in modules files i.e. ls                                     ActionParsnip, whats that for?
if there are other moduls mentioned, that's fine
those modules will also be loaded at boot
emoticons don't work here. thats sad
I use Pidgin for IRC when I am home
